docs.lead_paragraph: BabyUniverse, an online retailer and content publisher in the pregnancy, baby and toddler marketplace, said Wednesday it had completed a $5 million debt financing transaction with Hercules Technology Growth Capital.

headline.main: Baby Items Retailer Cleans Up Its Debt

docs.abstract: BabyUniverse, an online retailer and content publisher in the pregnancy, baby and toddler marketplace, said Wednesday it had completed a $5 million debt financing transaction with Hercules Technology Growth Capital. BabyUniverse, based in Jupter, Fla., said the money would be used primarily to refinance its existing senior debts. Palo Alto-based Hercules, founded in 2003, is [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: The Journal of the American Medical Association says it was misled by researchers who failed to disclose financial ties to drug companies.

headline.main: Medical Journal Says It Was Again Misled
headline.print_headline: Medical Journal Says It Was Again Misled

docs.snippet: The Journal of the American Medical Association says it was misled by researchers who failed to disclose financial ties to drug companies.

docs.lead_paragraph: For the second time in two months, The Journal of the American Medical Association says it was misled by researchers who failed to disclose financial ties to drug companies. The journal is tightening its policies for researchers as a result.

headline.main: Medical Journal Says It Was Again Misled

docs.abstract: Journal of American Medical Association reports that most of 13 authors of article it published on use of antidepressants during pregnancy have financial ties to drug companies, including antidepressant makers, but that just two disclosed their ties when study was published in February; report found that pregnant women who stop takng antidepressants risk slipping back into depression (M)
docs.snippet: For the second time in two months, The Journal of the American Medical Association says it was misled by researchers who failed to disclose financial ties to drug companies.     The journal is tightening its policies for researchers as a result.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: JOURNAL OF THE AMERICAN MEDICAL ASSN

docs.lead_paragraph: Chocolate and greasy foods will not cause acne, but can other foods?

headline.main: The Claim: Your Diet Can Bring on an Acne Outbreak
headline.sub: THE CLAIM  Your diet can bring on an acne outbreak. ;

docs.snippet: Chocolate and greasy foods will not cause acne, but can other foods?

docs.lead_paragraph: THE CLAIM -- Your diet can bring on an acne outbreak. THE FACTS -- Despite what parents everywhere have long insisted, most people know by now that chocolate and greasy foods will not cause acne. But can other foods? According to dermatologists, what largely determines whether a person develops acne are genetics and hormonal fluctuations, hence the tendency for it to occur during puberty, pregnancy and menopause.
docs.abstract: Research finds link between consuming dairy products and acne outbreaks, but does not support many other claims that certain foods, such as chocolate, are bad for skin; drawing (M)
